title: Why are there so many versions of a song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because you like let's say McArthur’'s Park by Richard Harris..many years later it was redone or covered by Donna Summer as a disco/dance song.there are over 3000 different versions of yesterday the Beatles classic..some were OK some phenomenal. I've heard reggae versions , country , rap , symphonic, you get the picture..love the.song yet hate the Beatles..Frank Sinatra sang it..artist like to do their take , there own versions of the song ..classic song maybe they wish they had written .I've also heard thousands of versions of O Holy Night..my favorite which gIves me goosebumps everytime is by Celine Dion..I've seen heavy metal Christmas records rap versions. Bottom line I bet you like a certain song I'm sure you can find it in just about any genre you prefer. .

Well, there are many versions of a song because, every artist has his own perception of a particular track. Sometimes, the other versions of a song are better than the originals. Sometimes, the chord patterns of songs match and artist make covers and mixes of two or more tracks, because, out of love for music and what not!! Many versions of a song. Reprise, Sad, Dubstep and bla bla blaWhy? Everytime the same style becomes monotonic. Just to get a different flavour, the songs are released.
